channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: What happens when a vaccine skeptic leads health policy? Ask Florida
item.description: Among the names being floated to head the Department of Health and Human Services are RFK Jr. and Florida Surgeon General Joseph Ladapo. Both are vaccine skeptics, which worries pediatricians.
item.content:encoded:
Among the names being floated to head the Department of Health and Human Services are RFK Jr. and Florida Surgeon General Joseph Ladapo. Both are vaccine skeptics, which worries pediatricians.

(Image credit: Rustam Shaimov)
item.dc:creator: Maria Godoy

item.title: The USS Edsall, sunk by Japanese forces in World War II, has been found
item.description: The USS Edsall was overpowered by a Japanese fleet in the Indian Ocean but fought valiantly to the end, the U.S. Navy said. It was found in deep waters south of Australia's Christmas Island.
item.content:encoded:
The USS Edsall was overpowered by a Japanese fleet in the Indian Ocean but fought valiantly to the end, the U.S. Navy said. It was found in deep waters south of Australia's Christmas Island.

(Image credit: U.S. Naval History and Heritage Command)
item.dc:creator: James Doubek

item.title: In Lebanon, residents fear Hezbollah could be hiding among people displaced by war
item.description: A neighborhood watch group in a Christian Beirut neighborhood is on the lookout for militant operatives, which could make the area a target for Israeli airstrikes.
item.content:encoded:
A neighborhood watch group in a Christian Beirut neighborhood is on the lookout for militant operatives, which could make the area a target for Israeli airstrikes.

(Image credit: Ali Khara for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Arezou Rezvani

item.title: 'Jump ball' for Alex Jones' media empire as it hits the auction block today
item.description: Live bidding will be private, and the future owner of Jones' company will be public once court papers are filed. The proceeds will go to pay Sandy Hook families who won defamation cases against Jones.
item.content:encoded:
Live bidding will be private, and the future owner of Jones' company will be public once court papers are filed. The proceeds will go to pay Sandy Hook families who won defamation cases against Jones.

(Image credit: Jeff Kowalsky)
item.dc:creator: Tovia Smith

item.title: Trump meets Biden in the Oval Office today. It's a tradition Trump skipped in 2020
item.description: President Biden called his predecessor — now, successor — a threat to democracy. Today he'll sit side by side with President-elect Trump as part of the ceremony around a smooth transfer of power.
item.content:encoded:
President Biden called his predecessor — now, successor — a threat to democracy. Today he'll sit side by side with President-elect Trump as part of the ceremony around a smooth transfer of power.

(Image credit: Win McNamee)
item.dc:creator: Tamara Keith

item.title: Nintendo has launched a music app, seizing on the appeal of video game playlists
item.description: The Nintendo Music app lets you listen to dozens of hours of music from games like Mario, Zelda and Donkey Kong.
item.content:encoded:
The Nintendo Music app lets you listen to dozens of hours of music from games like Mario, Zelda and Donkey Kong.

(Image credit: Dimitar Dilkoff)
item.dc:creator: Vincent Acovino

item.title: Israeli strikes kill dozens in the Gaza Strip and Lebanon, medics say
item.description: Israeli airstrikes killed at least 46 people in the Gaza Strip in the past day, medics said. In Lebanon, warplanes struck Beirut's southern suburbs and killed 33 people in the country on Tuesday.
item.content:encoded:
Israeli airstrikes killed at least 46 people in the Gaza Strip in the past day, medics said. In Lebanon, warplanes struck Beirut's southern suburbs and killed 33 people in the country on Tuesday.

(Image credit: Hassan Ammar)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: U.S. prohibits airlines from flying to Haiti after planes were shot by gangs
item.description: The shootings were part of a wave of violence that erupted as the country plagued by gang violence swore in its new prime minister after a politically tumultuous process.
item.content:encoded:
The shootings were part of a wave of violence that erupted as the country plagued by gang violence swore in its new prime minister after a politically tumultuous process.

(Image credit: Odelyn Joseph)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Trump will nominate South Dakota Gov. Kristi Noem for homeland security secretary
item.description: The two-term governor of South Dakota has been a loyal Trump ally. In her new role, Noem would oversee immigration, an issue Trump campaigned heavily on.
item.content:encoded:
The two-term governor of South Dakota has been a loyal Trump ally. In her new role, Noem would oversee immigration, an issue Trump campaigned heavily on.

(Image credit: Jeff Dean)
item.dc:creator: Jeongyoon Han

item.title: Trump taps Musk to lead a 'Department of Government Efficiency' with Ramaswamy
item.description: President-elect Trump announced a "Department of Government Efficiency," or DOGE, that will be led by Tesla CEO Elon Musk and entrepreneur Vivek Ramaswamy, focused on shrinking the federal government.
item.content:encoded:
President-elect Trump announced a "Department of Government Efficiency," or DOGE, that will be led by Tesla CEO Elon Musk and entrepreneur Vivek Ramaswamy, focused on shrinking the federal government.

(Image credit: Andrew Caballero-Reynolds and Alain Jocard)
item.dc:creator: Camila Domonoske
